intro: Dianthus monspessulanus var. fallens, commonly known as the falling carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its delicate, double-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and produces clusters of small, showy blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period, which can extend from spring through early autumn.
